It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Dread Yonko can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Dread Yonko's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Dread Yonko can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Dread Yonko's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Dread Emperor's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Dread Yonko would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Divine Departure, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Dread Yonko can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Dread Yonko after its Emperor's Wrath activates.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Dread Yonko has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Dread Yonko any abilities and spells it gives. The Dread Yonko will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Dread Yonko makes three saber attacks or three Air Slash attacks.

action.name: Supreme Meito
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d6 + 13}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the Dread Yonko.

action.name: Air Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d10}) slashing damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Dread Yonko magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 200 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Divine Departure {@recharge 5}
entries: The Dread Yonko leaps up to 200 feet to a point it can see and makes a weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of its landing spot with its Supreme Meito. Additionally, all creatures within 60 feet of the landing spot must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 14d12}) force damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Observation Killer
entries: The Dread Yonko can use its reaction to cancel one Color of Observation spell, ability, or dice-altering effect being used by a creature it can see.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Dread Yonko can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Heaven-Splitting Slash
entries: The Dread Yonko slashes its sword, sending out an energy slash which forms a line 150 feet long and 20 feet high. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes ({@dice 6d8}) slashing damage and ({@dice 6d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack (2/Round)
entries: The Dread Yonko makes a Supreme Meito attack.
If the Dread Yonko's Dread Emperor's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Emperor's Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Dread Yonko manifests its spirit into a suit of armor that protects it; it gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of its next turn.

Let's End this War (Costs 2 Actions). The Dread Yonko and its allies within 100 feet gain a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the Dread Yonko's next turn. Additionally, the Dread Yonko and its allies in this area also receive 20 temporary hit points, immunity from the {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} condition, and advantage on Saving throws made against Color of the Supreme King haki.

monster.name: Sea King Lord [Epic]
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (with others that can hear the "voice of all things")

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sea King Lord's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}; {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Sea King Lord can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Chomp
entries: The Sea King Lord can use a bonus action to make a bite or swallow attack against a creature it has {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Colossal
entries: The Sea King Lord's space is 45' x 45'.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Sea King Lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Sea King Lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Sea King Lord's weapon attacks are treated as magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Sea King Lord would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Seawater Cannon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Sea King Lord can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Sea King Lord after its Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea activates.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Sea King Lord's weapon attacks do double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Sense
entries: When the Sea King Lord is completely submerged it gains tremorsense to 240 feet.

trait.name: Waves of Wrath
entries: Any bludgeoning damage dealt by the Sea King Lord from water-based attacks counts as magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sea King Lord can make one Bite Attack and one Constrict or Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 7d10 + 16}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 10d6}) cold damage, and if the Sea King Lord wishes, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). If the creature is Large or smaller it is also {@condition restrained}. As long as the Sea King Lord maintains the grapple, it cannot bite another creature.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d10 + 16}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the sea king can't constrict another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 45 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 7d12 + 16}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 30} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 30 feet, the Sea King Lord's choice, and {@condition stunned} until the end of the Sea King's next turn.

action.name: Thunderous Roar
entries: The Sea King unleashes a deafening roar that can be felt and heard by any creature within 90 feet of it. Each creature in this area must make a {@dc 30} Constitution saving throw, taking ({@dice 11d6}) thunder damage and being {@condition deafened} on a failed save or taking half as much damage and not being {@condition deafened} on a successful save.

action.name: Seawater Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: The Sea King Lord exhales a 280-foot cone wave of frigid seawater. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 195 ({@damage 30d12}) bludgeoning damage and 195 ({@damage 30d12}) cold damage, and is pushed to the end of the cone and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Swallow
entries: A Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the Sea King must make a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Sea King, and it takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) acid damage at the start of each of the Sea King's turns.

The Sea King's stomach has an AC of 21 and if it takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Sea King must makea {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed contents of its stomach. Creatures that are regurgitated fall {@condition prone} within 10 feet of the Sea King. If the Sea King dies, a creature is no longer swallowed and may escape from the corpse by using 55 feet of its movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Sea King Lord can make a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Sea King Lord can move up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Whirlpool (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord forms a 30-foot radius vortex in a body of water within 120 feet of it and lasts until the end of the Sea King Lord's next turn. The vortex is considered difficult terrain and each creature or vehicle which starts its turn in the vortex's area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pulled to the center of the vortex. Additionally, creatures within the vortex without a swim speed have disadvantage on their attacks while they remain inside it.

legendary.name: Thunderous Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord makes a Thunderous Roar attack.

legendary.name: Innate Casting (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord casts an at-will spell.
If the Sea King Lord's Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Explosive Dive (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord dives into the water in an explosive motion. Each creature within 30 ft. of the Sea King Lord must succeed on a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw or take ({@dice 3d10}) bludgeoning damage and ({@dice 3d10}) cold damage from the splash and be knocked {@condition prone}. The Sea King can then swim up to its swimming speed.

mythic.name: Tail Sweep (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: The Sea King swings its tail in a 45-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 30} Dexterity saving throw or take ({@dice 7d12 + 16}) bludgeoning damage, be pushed back 30 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition stunned} until the end of the Sea King's next turn.

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The logia user has eaten the Moku Moku no mi Devil Fruit, allowing its user to transform into, use, and manipulate smoke, becoming a "smoke human". It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Logia Guard
entries: The logia user can spend an action to enter it's logia guard form. While in this form, it gains the following benefits:

items: It gains a +2 bonus to AC.
It has advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

It becomes a misty cloud of smoke for the duration, making its only method of movement a flying speed equal to its movement speed. It can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks. It remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise Incapacitated, unless by seastone or water. It can move through the space of another creature, and it doesn't count as difficult terrain. If it ends its turn in another creature's space, it is shunted to the last unoccupied space you occupied, and it takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

It chooses which equipment it is holding transforms into its element and travels with it normally. Worn equipment functions as usual, but benefits from the logia user's resistances and immunities and attacks that normally phase through it will also phase through its equipment as if it is a part of its body.

entries: Moku Moku no Mi (Very Rare). This devil fruit has 13 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 15 and it has a {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks. The user of this fruit can use an action to cast {@spell mage hand}, and its reach with its melee weapons increases by 30 feet, as its arms can turn into smoke and extend outward. Alternatively, it can expend 1 or more of the devil fruit's charges to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Fog Cloud} (1 charge), {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Gaseous Form} (3 charges), {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges), {@spell Cloudkill} (5 charges), {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell Wind Walk} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.. The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Seastone Weapon
entries: The tip of the rapier held by the logia user is made of seastone, and forces any Devil Fruit-using creature it hits to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be subjected to its seastone weakness effects. Additionally, the rapier ignores immunity to piercing damage from devil fruit users.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The logia user makes three attacks with its seastone rapier. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of smoke or fog created by the logia user on a previous turn, the logia user can dismiss that smoke or fog and cause the target to take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage from smoke inhalation. The logia user can dismiss smoke or fog in this way no more than once per turn.

action.name: Seastone Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. The logia user can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with smoke or fog (such as from the {@spell fog cloud} spell), which remains for 1 minute.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The paramecia user's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • 3/day each: blur, expeditious retreat, feather fall (self), jump (self), misty step, see invisibility, shield • 1/day each: arcane eye, haste (self) Netsu Netsu no Mi (Rare). This devil fruit has 9 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 13 and it has a {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks. The user of this fruit can use an action to cast fire bolt or heat metal. Alternatively, it can expend 1 or more of the devil fruit's charges to cast one of the following spells from it: burning hands (1 charge), hellish rebuke (1 charge), scorching ray (2 charges), wall of fire (4 charges), or flame strike (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The paramecia user has eaten the Netsu Netsu no mi Devil Fruit, allowing its user to use and manipulate heat, becoming a "heat human". It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Observation Haki (1/Day)
entries: Whenever the paramecia user makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The paramecia user can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the paramecia user's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

walk.condition: (50 ft. in lion or hybrid form)

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The zoan user has eaten the Neko Neko no mi, Model: Lion zoan devil fruit, allowing it to transform into a lion or lion hybrid. It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The zoan user can use its action to polymorph into a Large lion-humanoid hybrid or into a Large lion, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it. is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The zoan user has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the zoan user moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zoan user can make one bite Attack against it as a bonus Action.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: In humanoid form, the zoan user makes two cutlass attacks or one rifle attack. In hybrid form, it can attack like a humanoid or make two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cutlass (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Musket (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tinkerer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The tinkerer has the following wizard spells prepared: • Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, gust, prestidigitation • 1st level (4 slots): burning hands, mage armor, magic missile, shield • 2nd level (3 slots): mirror image, scorching ray • 3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt, major image • 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, storm sphere • 5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

action.name: Quarterstaff (Melee; One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Quarterstaff (Melee; Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elbaf warrior makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear (Melee; One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d6 + 9}) piercing damage

action.name: Spear (Melee; Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage

action.name: Spear (Ranged)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d6 + 9}) piercing damage Shield Bash Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d4 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. It must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The elbaf warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the elbaf warrior must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the bounty hunter has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the bounty hunter scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Confronting Capture
entries: The bounty hunter doesn't suffer disadvantage when making ranged attacks made within 5 feet of a creature. Additionally, creatures have disadvantage when attempting to resist being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} as a result of any effect the bounty hunter creates.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the bounty hunter is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the bounty hunter instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Bounty Hunter deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the bounty hunter that isn't incapacitated and the bounty hunter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bounty hunter makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 7d6}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking the poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage

action.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage

action.name: Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}0 (1d0) bludgeoning damage. The target is Restrained. A creature can use its Action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, Ending the Effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net, AC 10, frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The samurai has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Precise Strikes
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the samurai hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Katana (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage

action.name: Katana (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The samurai adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the samurai must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

ac.condition: in sulong form in mink form

climb.condition: (40 ft. climb 40 ft. in sulong form)

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: While exposed to a full moon, the mink can use its action to polymorph into a Large sulong mink form, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies or is no longer exposed to the full moon.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The mink has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mink makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 1d8}) lightning damage. The target takes takes an extra ({@dice 2d10}) piercing damage if the mink is in its sulong form.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 1d8}) lightning damage. The target takes an extra ({@dice 2d8}) slashing damage if the mink is in its sulong form.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Fish-Man Karate)
headerEntries: The fish-man's spellcasting ability is Wisdom, spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • 3/day each: feather fall, jump, misty step, see invisibility • 1/day: cone of cold

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the fish-man is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fish-man makes three unarmed strikes or three water missile attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, the fish-man can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (fish-man's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the fish-man's next turn

action.name: Water Missile
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) cold damage

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the fish-man is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fish-man makes three unarmed strikes or three water missile attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the fish-man can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (fish-man's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the fish-man's next turn

action.name: Water Missile
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) cold damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Seraphim's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: detect magic, burning hands (as a 9th-level spell) 3/day each: dispel magic, fireball 1/day each: flame strike, sunburst

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The Seraphim can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Destructive Death
entries: When the Seraphim dies, it explodes. Each creature within 30-feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried.

trait.name: Face Scan
entries: A Seraphim instantly recognizes the name, bounty, and any other public knowldge of a creature it can see.

trait.name: Fiery Weapons
entries: The Seraphim's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage (included in the weapon attacks below).

trait.name: Flame Change
entries: The Seraphim can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate its flame. If it's flame is deactivated, the sepharim becomes resistant to fire damage instead of immune and receives a -2 penalty to Armor Class, but moves at double its movement speed and gains advantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws for the duration. These changes are reverted once the Seraphim re-activates its flame.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Seraphim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit Lineage. If the Seraphim has been infused with Devil Fruit lineage factors, it gains a Very Rare or lower Fruit power, granting the Seraphim any abilities and spells it gives. The Seraphim will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Seraphim makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Longsword (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Longsword (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d10 + 9}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Shave
entries: The sepharim magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Laser Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The Seraphim fires an exploding laser beam at a point it can see within 120 feet. The explosion erupts in a 60-radius sphere centered on the chosen point, forcing each creature in the area to make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 26d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The pacifista can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Destructive Death
entries: When the pacifista dies, it explodes. Each creature within 30-feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried.

trait.name: Face Scan
entries: A pacifista instantly recognizes the name, bounty, and any other government knowledge of a creature it can see.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The pacifista is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pacifista has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The pacifista's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pacifista makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Laser Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The pacifista fires an exploding laser beam at a point it can see within 120 feet. The explosion erupts in a 60-radius sphere centered on the chosen point, forcing each creature in the area to make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 18d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers)
headerEntries: The Assassin's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • 3/day each: blur, expeditious retreat, feather fall (self), jump (self), misty step, see invisibility, shield • 1/day each: haste (self), stoneskin (self)

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the Assassin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Assassin has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains an Uncommon or Rare Fruit power, granting the Assassin any abilities and spells it gives. The Assassin will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Assassin makes three finger gun attacks or three storm leg attacks.

action.name: Finger Gun
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Storm Leg
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d6 + 4}) slashing damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Assassin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Six King Gun {@recharge}
entries: Melee Weapon: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., One target. {@h}({@dice 2d8 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points. If it succeeds, it takes ({@dice 10d10}) force damage. Until the end of the Assassin's next turn, it can't take an Action on its turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

trait.name: Celestial Helmet
entries: The Celestial Dragon wears a bubble-like helmet around its head which supplies it with fresh air. While it wears this helmet, it is immune to any effect that would cause the Celestial Dragon to suffocate or become {@condition poisoned} from an airborne gas. If the Celestial Dragon takes 4 or more damage in a single turn, its helmet breaks.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Pirate Leader's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 27}; {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic, toll the dead (17th level) • 3/day each: blur, dominate person, fear, jump (self) • 1/day each: arcane eye, control weather, death ward (self), dominate monster, earthquake, psychic scream

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Pirate Leader fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: King's Infusion Armament Haki
entries: The Pirate Leader's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Pirate Leader also adds an additional ({@dice 4d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks and increases its melee weapon attack range by 5 feet.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Pirate Leader makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Pirate Leader can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Pirate Leader's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Pirate Leader can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Pirate Leader's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Emperor's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Pirate Leader would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Cataclysmic Slam, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Pirate Leader can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Pirate Leader after its Emperor's Wrath activates.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Pirate Leader has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Pirate Leader any abilities and spells it gives. The Pirate Leader will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pirate Leader makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 4d8}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sonic Boom
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 9d6}) thunder damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Pirate Leader magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Cataclysmic Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pirate Leader slams the ground with haki and releases crushing force in a 60-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 ({@damage 11d12}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Cull the Weak
entries: The Pirate Leader casts {@spell toll the dead|XGE} (17th level)

legendary.name: Furious Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader makes one Unarmed Strike attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the Pirate Leader until the end of its next turn.
If the Pirate Leader's Emperor's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Emperor's Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader manifests his spirit into a suit of armor that protects it; it gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of its next turn.

mythic.name: Ravaging Wave (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader unleashes a wave of deadly spirit energy. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the Pirate Leader must succeed on a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ({@dice 4d12}) force damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Supreme Meito
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d8}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shave

legendary.name: Supreme Meito
entries: The Pirate Elite makes one Supreme Meito attack.

legendary.name: Evasive Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Elite moves up to its speed while guarding against future attacks. The next melee attack made by a creature that targets the Pirate Elite until the end of the Pirate Elite's next turn is made at disadvantage. Additionally, the Pirate Elite can make an Attack with its Supreme Meito against the creature that made the attack.

The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

action.name: Unarmed Strike

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Marine Elite's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic • 3/day each: blur, dominate person, jump (self), steel wind strike • 1/day each: arcane eye, death ward (self), dominate monster

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Marine Elite fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Armament Haki
entries: The Marine Elite's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Marine Elite also adds an additional ({@dice 3d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Marine Elite makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Marine Elite can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Marine Elite's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Marine Elite can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Marine Elite's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Marine Elite has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Very Rare or Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Marine Elite any abilities and spells it gives. The Marine Elite will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Marine Elite makes two attacks with its Supreme Meito.

action.name: Supreme Meito
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d8}) force damage. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ranged Sword Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 7d6}) slashing damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Marine Elite magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Marine Elite makes one attack.

legendary.name: Rallying Cry
entries: The Marine Elite bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the Marine Elite's next turn.

legendary.name: Conqueror's Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Marine elite releases a debilitating shockwave using its spirit. All other creatures within 60 feet of the Marine Elite must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Marine Elite's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • 3/day each: blur, barkskin (self), jump (self), misty step • 1/day each: arcane eye, haste (self), stoneskin (self)

trait.name: Armament Haki
entries: The Marine Elite's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Marine Elite also adds an additional ({@dice 3d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks.

It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Marine Elite can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Marine Elite's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Marine Elite has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains an Uncommon or Rare Fruit power, granting the Marine Elite any abilities and spells it gives. The Marine Elite will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Marine Elite makes three attacks with its katana.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d8}) force damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers)
headerEntries: The Marine Soldier's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • 3/day each: blur, barkskin (self), jump (self), misty step

trait.name: Marine Formation
entries: The Marine Soldier receives a +2 bonus to AC if one or more of its allies are within 5 ft. of it and aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Marine Soldier hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Marine Soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage

trait.name: Marine Formation
entries: The Marine Soldier receives a +2 bonus to AC if one or more of its allies are within 5 ft. of it and aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Shorter Loading
entries: The Marine Soldier only needs to spend a bonus action to fully reload Bazookas or Machine Guns. They must still use the loading properties.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Marine Soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage

action.name: Bazooka
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 60/300 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and there is a 10% chance that the ammunition fired won't explode on contact. When this happens, the damage type is bludgeoning instead of fire.

trait.name: Marine Formation
entries: The Marine Soldier receives a +2 bonus to AC if one or more of its allies are within 5 ft. of it and aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage

table.name: Traveling Events
table.caption: Traveling Events
rows: Battle. A sea beast attacks the ship.
A lone bounty hunter begins stalking the ship from miles away.
A school of bright fish swarm the ship. Roll for fishing check at advantage.
Random wanted posters are blown onto the ship.
A merchant ship passes by, offering the characters funny-looking food.
A tiny island with a single palm tree on it can be seen.
Phosphorescent algae floats in the water, becoming visible at night.
A talking dolphin emerges and attempts to annoy the crew.
An unmanned rowboat full of random trinkets bumps into the ship.
Survivors from a boating accident are stranded on a small island ahead.
Battle. A Marine ship barrels toward the players ship.
A message in a bottle floats past the ship (spot DC 15).
Battle. A group of fish-men pirates begin circling the ship.
An island of floating trash and waste is seen floating ahead.
Large sea lilies can be seen sprouting over the surface of the water.
A hollow floating tree trunk carries green lobsters inside.
Battle. A pirate ship attacks with its cannons from afar.
Barrels full of cheap booze can be seen floating.
Large seahorses with saddles appear, wanting players to ride them.
A storm suddenly appears (See "Weather") and blows fish onto the ship.
The ship drifts into the calm belt and must escape from sea kings.
A colossal blowfish trampolines the ship into the sky (See "Crashing").
Battle. A group of bounty hunters attack the ship.
Layers of seaweed encompass the surrounding ocean surface for the day.
A lone researcher on a small boat asks for directions.
A floating village full of friendly citizens can be seen ahead.
Colossal jellyfish begin to cling to the sides of the ship until pulled off.
A navy ship with broken steering is stuck doing circles in the distance.
Battle. A group of tribal warriors riding plesiosaurs attack the ship.
A giant venus fly trap drifts ahead lifelessly, carrying a pop green.
Flaming waterspouts that deal fire damage emerge (See "Weather").
A fake poneglyph sits sunken in shallow water (Spot DC 14).
Glaciers form and then melt quickly around the boat (See "Crashing").
Multi-colored sea turtles spit sparkling water at the crew.
A large ship carrying a map to a nearby sky island falls from the sky.
Life rings carrying skeletons drift by.
A pirate Warlord flies overhead, only attacking if provoked.
Battle. A kraken and colossal whale begin fighting near the ship.
An insane samurai rides a giant eagle overhead.
Battle. Two pirate ships attempt to sandwich and board the players ship.
Giant manta rays fly out of the sea and carry the ship at double pace for the day (See "Travel Pace")
A purple palm tree sticks out of shallow water. There is a 50% chance it holds a devil fruit.
Battle. Coral reef golems board the ship and attack.
The sea begins to boil, badly burning anyone who enters the water.
A submarine carrying illegal weapons travels beneath the ship (spot DC 15).
A knockup stream shoots the players ship onto a nearby sky island.
A vacationing marine admiral sits in a shallow sandbar, with a 50% chance of attempting to spot the players ship.
Battle. Giant flying scorpions attempt to capture players.
A killer whale carrying a meito in its mouth defends players from a sea king.
A marine battleship is seen miles away, bombing an island.
A floating magnetic island pulls the ship up to it.
Impossibly thick fog surrounds the players ship. Roll for an additional event.
Battle. Ships with poisoned arrows attack the players ship.
Flying starfish hover over the ship and give directions.
A marine prison boat is destroyed by an escaping giant prisoner.
The ocean turns blood red and various bones float to the surface.
A legendary creature can be seen far away, but disappears when approached.
Muscular crab men offer to repair any damage on the players ship.
Battle. A ship from a Yonko's crew attempts to raid and steal player treasure.
An escaping refugee with devil fruit powers is seen drowning nearby.
A huge rift opens in the sea temporarily, threatening to swallow nearby ships.
A colossal goldfish consumes a small nearby island.
Fallen sky islanders ride around in wavers filled with dials.
Swarms of sea termites attack the boat, forming holes in the hull.
Eastern-style umbrellas mysteriously fall from the sky onto the boat.
A flying elephant and other zoo animals offer to take players on a journey.
A volcano instantly rises out of the sea, erupting within minutes.
A corporeal rainbow ahead forms a bridge to a cloud holding a pot of gold.
Battle. A dragon turtle gives chase to players from far behind.
Creepy dolls sit atop empty floating coffins that drift past.
Sea bumble bees bring pollen from nearby to their underwater hives.
An acidic hailstorm which deals acid damage pelts the players and their ship (See "Weather").
The sea freezes over for the day, decreasing travel pace to 0.
Battle. Giant crocodiles with top hats attempt to dine on players.
Large mushrooms stick out of the water, providing platforms to bounce on.
Merfolk request assistance fending off an undersea tyrant, granting waterbreathing to players temporarily.
Large bubbles rise out of nearby water, emitting verbs when popped.
A small island made of icecream appears, but is actually the lure of a giant anglerfish.
Battle. Dozens of crawling claws rain onto the ship and attack.
A vicious thunderstorm rampages for a full day, requiring three navigation checks to clear (See "Weather").
Traveling priests bless players, preventing any bad weather from occurring around them for 1d4 days.
Fish-men running a seafood stall offer extremely overpriced food to humans.
Battle. An admiral and marine fleet give chase to players and attempt to surround them.
A kind aquamarine dragon has lost its eggs to poachers, and requests help from the players.
Light rain showers the players ship (See "Weather"), but fully heals all creatures and undestroyed structures it touches.
Battle. Giant vultures drop cannonballs onto the players ship.
A gas weapon explodes near the ship, spreading a deadly disease to players.
A solar eclipse occurs, blinding players who look directly into it for 1d4 days.
The players ship enters a field that has zero gravity, but doesn't affect travel pace.
Battle. A yonko fleet attempts to surround players, demanding a large toll be paid.
A powerful EMP hits the ship, disabling all electronics, compasses, and log poses for 1d4 days.
A rainbow-colored barrel full of fake devil fruits is delivered to the players by rainbow penguins. There is a  10% chance one of the devil fruits is actually real.
Titanic shadows can be seen from the sky, looking over the players ship.
Visible schools of fish underwater form a map to a hidden island nearby.
The ship crashes into a real poneglyph in shallow water (See "Crashing").
Floating fortresses demand that players allow their goods to be inspected or face imprisonment.
Friendly sirens encourage players, raising morale and giving inspiration.
Battle. A nearby elbaf battleship threatens to attack all evil crews and ships on sight.
A mist rises out of the sea for a minute, causing players to hallucinate.
Battle. A number of sea kings chase the players ship.

table.name: Fishing
table.caption: Fishing
rows: Sea Monster: The character reels in an aggravated Sea Beast, which proceeds to attack. There's a 10% chance the character reels in a Sea King instead.
Trash: The character reels in a bunch of worthless junk.
Weapon or Armor: The character reels in a random mundane weapon or piece of armor.
Treasure Chest: The character reels in a chest that has 1d100 x ฿10,000 worth of treasure and gold inside. There's a 20% chance the chest has a treasure map and eternal pose inside.
Small Fish: Character reels in a fish equal to 1 day worth of food. The fish has a 10% chance of being poisonous.
Large Fish: Character reels in a fish equal to 1d4 + their Wisdom modifier days worth of food.
Legendary Fish: Character reels in a fish equal to 10 days worth of food.

vehicle.name: Caravel

control.name: Helm
entries: Controls movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the caravel can't turn.

movement.hpNote: Loses 5 ft. of speed per 25 damage taken to sails.

entries: Speed 35 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 50 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Cannon

other.name: Ship Details

Recharging requires the waver or dial to rest for up to 8 hours without interruption. The dial can be replaced by another large breath dial if lost or broken.

The submarine detects all objects and creatures within 300 ft. using sonar detection and can relay the information to a screen in the helm, as if using blindsight. If the helm is destroyed, the submarine can no longer detect anything using sonar.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Dial Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Special Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 12 (requires {@item dial|D&DF-PHB} proficiency)
**Component Cost.** ฿5,000,000 + 5% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 25

**Locomotion (water).** Large breath dial or jet dial, adds speed to one movement component; speed +60 ft. if attached to a Medium vehicle; +30 ft. if attached to a Large vehicle; +15 ft. if attached to a Huge vehicle; and +10 ft. if attached to a Gargantuan vehicle; stacking with each additional dial attached (maximum bonus +60 ft.). Adds 1 mph bonus to travel pace for every +10 ft. bonus.
A dial will run for up to 2 hours before it needs to be recharged for 8 hours.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Oars Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Large
**Upgrade DC.** 10
**Component Cost.** ฿100,000 + 5% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 100; -5 ft. speed per 25 damage taken
**Locomotion (water).** Oars, speed based on ship type.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Sails Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿1,000,000 + 10% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 100; -5 ft. speed per 20 damage taken
**Locomotion (water).** Sails, speed based on ship type.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Paddle-Wheel Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 17
**Component Cost.** ฿10,000,000 + 20% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 100; -10 ft. speed per 25 damage taken
**Locomotion (water).** Paddle-wheel, 35 ft. while the helm is intact (4 mph).

vehicleUpgrade.name: Propeller Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 17
**Component Cost.** ฿20,000,000 + 20% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100; -5 ft. speed per 25 damage taken
**Locomotion (water).** Propeller, speed 45 ft. while the helm is intact (5 mph).

vehicleUpgrade.name: Rocket Booster Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿100,000,000 + 50% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100; -1 mile flight speed per 20 damage taken

The rocket booster allows for a vehicle to fly for up to 5 miles in any direction it chooses for up to 10 seconds. Afterwards, the ship lands and the booster must recharge for 24 hours before reuse. There is a 25% chance the ship crashes during landing.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Flight Core Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Gargantuan
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿500,000,000 + 100% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 3
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100; -5 ft. speed per 20 damage taken
**Locomotion (air).** Flight, speed 35 ft.; if the core is destroyed, the vehicle falls and crashes (4 mph).

vehicleUpgrade.name: Standard Fuel Engine Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Advanced Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 12
**Component Cost.** ฿4,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 16
**Hit Points.** 25
Counts as 4 crew members and powers movement components requiring an engine. Requires fuel.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Large Fuel Engine Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Advanced Large
**Upgrade DC.** 17
**Component Cost.** ฿10,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 16
**Hit Points.** 50
Counts as 10 crew members and powers movement components requiring an engine. Requires fuel.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Huge Fuel Engine Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Advanced Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿50,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 16
**Hit Points.** 100
Counts as 50 crew members and powers movement components requiring an engine. Requires fuel.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Wing Attachment Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿500,000 + 10% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 50
A falling vehicle's descent slows to 60 ft. per round, avoiding crashes from falls. The ship can glide. If destroyed midair, the vehicle falls and crashes.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Helm Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Large
**Upgrade DC.** 10
**Component Cost.** 5% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 12
**Hit Points.** 50
Controls movement components with one 90-degree turn. If destroyed, the vehicle can't turn.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Control Room Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿5,000,000 + 10% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 15
**Hit Points.** 100
Controls movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If destroyed, the vehicle can't turn. Has full cover from attacks outside the vehicle.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Steel Plating Upgrade
entries: Note: Can be added after initial construction.
**Component Type.** Size determined by vehicle size
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿50,000,000 + 30% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
Incorporates steel plating around the hull, increasing damage threshold by 5, granting immunity to necrotic damage, and raising AC to 18. The vehicle moves at half speed.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Element Resistant Wax Upgrade
entries: Note: Can be added after initial construction.
**Component Type.** Special (size determined by vehicle size)
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿5,000,000 + 30% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
Applies a wax coating granting the hull resistance to one chosen damage type until removed. Only one coating can be active at a time.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Adam Wood Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Special (size determined by vehicle size)
**Upgrade DC.** 17
**Component Cost.** ฿100,000,000 + 50% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
Incorporates Adam Wood into the hull, increasing damage threshold by 5 and granting +2 AC to all components.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Seastone Bottom Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Special (size determined by vehicle size)
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿300,000,000 + 50% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
Incorporates seastone onto the bottom of the ship, allowing passage through the Calm Belt by avoiding detection from underwater creatures.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Docking Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* Vehicle must be Gargantuan.
**Component Type.** Gargantuan
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿10,000,000 + 30% of ship cost
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
Allows docking for up to 7 Huge or smaller vehicles. One vehicle can be released from docking per turn.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Carronade Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 10
**Component Cost.** ฿10,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 15
**Hit Points.** 30
*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +6 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. *Hit:* (2d10) bludgeoning damage.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Cannon Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 10
**Component Cost.** ฿20,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 15
**Hit Points.** 50
*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +6 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. *Hit:* (3d10) bludgeoning damage.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Large Cannon Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 12
**Component Cost.** ฿80,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 15
**Hit Points.** 100
*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +5 to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. *Hit:* (5d10) bludgeoning damage.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Harpoon Cannon Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Medium
**Upgrade DC.** 10
**Component Cost.** ฿25,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 15
**Hit Points.** 50

*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +6 to hit, range 120/400 ft., one target. *Hit:* (3d6) piercing damage and grapples the target (escape DC 15). The rope has AC 10, 15 HP, vulnerability to fire, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Ram Upgrade
entries: **Component Type.** Large
**Upgrade DC.** 15
**Component Cost.** ฿50,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 1
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100 (threshold 10)
Gives advantage on crash saves. Damage from collisions is applied to the ram instead of the hull. These benefits don't apply if another vehicle crashes into this one.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Flamethrower Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿300,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100
**Flamethrower.** Sprays a 30-ft cone of fire (DC 16 Dex save, 45 (10d8) fire damage). Flammable objects ignite. Recharge: 24 hours.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Beam Cannon Upgrade
entries: *Requirement:* At least one huge engine installed on the ship and a control component.
**Component Type.** Special Huge
**Upgrade DC.** 20
**Component Cost.** ฿500,000,000
**Upgrade Slots Required.** 2
**Armor Class.** 18
**Hit Points.** 100
**Force Beam.** Fires a 90-ft line (5 ft. wide, DC 16 Dex save, 45 (10d8) force damage). Disintegrates nonmagical Medium or smaller objects; destroys 5-ft cubes of larger targets. Recharge: 24 hours.

classFeature.name: Holy Power (Spellcasting)
entries: As a conduit for divine energy, you can cast Priest Holy Powers (Spells). Priest holy powers count as Priest Spells in chapter 8.
Natural Abilities (Cantrips)

At 1st Level, you know three Cantrips of your choice from the Priest spell list. You learn additional Priest cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Natural Abilities Known (Cantrips ,Known) column of the Priest table.
Preparing and Casting Holy Powers (Spells)

The Priest table shows how many Holy Power Slots (Spell Slots) you have to cast your Priest Holy Powers of 1st Level and higher. To cast one of these holy powers, you must expend a slot of the holy ,power's level or             higher. You regain all expended Spell Slots when you finish a Long Rest. You prepare the list of Holy Powers (Spells) that are available for you to cast, choosing from the ,Priest spell list. When you do so, choose a             number of Priest holy powers equal to your Wisdom modifier + your Priest level (minimum of one holy power). The holy power must be of a level for ,which you have Holy Power Slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level Priest, you have four 1st- level and two 2nd-level Holy Power Slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared Holy Powers can include six holy powers of 1st or 2nd ,Level, in             any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level holy power (spell) Cure Wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the holy power doesn't remove it from your ,list of prepared holy powers.

You can change your list of prepared holy powers when you finish a Long Rest. Preparing a new list of Priest holy powers requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per Holy Power ,Level for each holy power on your list.
Special Power Ability (Spellcasting)

Wisdom is your Special Power (Spellcasting) ability for your Priest Holy Powers (Spells). The strength of your holy powers comes from your devotion to your God. You use your Wisdom whenever a Priest ,holy power            (spell) refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Priest holy power you cast and when making an Attack ,roll with one.
**Holy Power save DC** = 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Wisdom modifier
**Holy Power Attack modifier** = your Proficiency Bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Ritual Casting
You can cast a Priest holy power as a ritual if that holy power has the ritual tag and you have the holy power prepared.
Special Power Focus (Spellcasting Focus)
You can use a holy symbol as a special power focus for your Priest Holy Powers.

classFeature.name: Divine Domain
entries: Each domain has a list of holy powers (spells)—its domain holy powers—that you gain at the Priest levels noted in the domain description. Once you gain a domain holy power, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of Holy Powers you can prepare each day. If you have a domain holy power (spell) that doesn't appear on the Priest spell list, the holy power is nonetheless a Priest holy power for you.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel special powers. You start with two such effects:  Turn Undead and an effect determined by your domain.

Some domains grant you additional effects as you advance in levels, as noted in the domain description. When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again. Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your priest holy power save DC.

Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level, you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

classFeature.name: Turn Undead
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat listed in **Chapter 6**. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat listed in **Chapter 6**. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat listed in **Chapter 6**. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat listed in **Chapter 6**. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat listed in **Chapter 6**. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: A Call Beyond
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can channel your God's spirit directly through you to summon it and wish for greater power. Channeling this divine energy to make a wish requires an action. Describe the effect you want, and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your Priest level, your wish comes true. The DM chooses the Nature of the wish; the Effect of any Priest spell or Priest domain spell would be appropriate. If this effect succeeds, you can't use this feature again for 7 days. Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a Long Rest. At 20th level, your Call Beyond succeeds automatically, no roll required.

classFeature.name: A Call Beyond
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can channel your God's spirit directly through you to summon it and wish for greater power. Channeling this divine energy to make a wish requires an action. Describe the effect you want, and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your Priest level, your wish comes true. The DM chooses the Nature of the wish; the Effect of any Priest spell or Priest domain spell would be appropriate. If this effect succeeds, you can't use this feature again for 7 days. Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a Long Rest. At 20th level, your Call Beyond succeeds automatically, no roll required.

classFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: When you reach 8th level, you are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal 1d8 radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Destroy Undead
entries: Starting at 5th level, when an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below a certain threshold, as shown in the Destroy Undead table.
